title: Hand-on Ex03
text: This interactive scatter plot reveals student IDs on hover, enabling precise identification of individual performance without cluttering the visualization with permanent labels, enhancing analysis efficiency.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text: This interactive scatter plot reveals student IDs on hover, enabling precise identification of individual performance without cluttering the visualization with permanent labels, enhancing analysis efficiency.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Custom Tooltip Styling






Enhanced tooltips provide comprehensive student information on hover, combining multiple data fields in a styled format for improved context and readability during exploratory data analysis.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Hover Highlighting Effect






Class-based highlighting visually groups students when hovering over any class member, facilitating pattern recognition across the distribution and enabling instant identification of class performance characteristics.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Coordinated Multiple Views






These coordinated views enable cross-subject analysis by highlighting the same student across both distributions simultaneously, facilitating pattern identification and outlier detection across subjects at the individual level.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Plotly Interactive Visualization






Using ggplotly transforms static visualizations into interactive ones with minimal code changes, adding tooltips, zoom capabilities, and filtering options that enhance exploratory data analysis beyond what’s possible with static displays.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Plotly Coordinated Views






This linked visualization allows selection in one plot to highlight corresponding points in the other, enabling multi-dimensional performance analysis across subjects and revealing relationships that might be missed in single-view analysis.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Interactive Data Table






The interactive data table allows sorting, filtering, and paginating through the complete dataset, complementing visualizations with the ability to inspect and analyze individual records in detail.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Basic Animation









This multi-panel visualization shows class performance across different subjects, allowing comparison of achievement patterns between classes. The charts reveal which classes maintain consistent performance across disciplines versus those showing significant subject-specific strengths or weaknesses.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Animated Scatter Plot






The animated scatter plot visualizes global development trends over time, revealing the dynamic relationship between economic performance and quality of life metrics while enabling interactive exploration of specific countries and regions.

title: Hand-on Ex03
text:
Enhanced Animation Effects









This series of scatter plots captures global development trends at key time points (1952, 1977, and 2002), revealing the relationship between economic performance and life expectancy. Comparing these snapshots illustrates how countries and regions have developed over the half-century period, showing patterns of progress and disparity.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text: Male/Female numbers are similar; females are slightly more numerous (≈5% difference), suggesting no major gender imbalance in this cohort.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text: Male/Female numbers are similar; females are slightly more numerous (≈5% difference), suggesting no major gender imbalance in this cohort.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Subject Score Comparison









English scores show the highest median with a compact distribution, while Science has the lowest median and more outliers. Mathematics demonstrates moderate performance with several low outliers, indicating variable student proficiency across subjects.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Math Score Distribution









The mean (red dashed line) sits near the centre of a bell-shaped curve (~66 points), indicating symmetric performance with few extreme scores.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Dot Plot Visualization









The dot plot reveals the precise distribution of individual math scores, showing clustering around 65-75 points with relatively few students at extreme ends of the spectrum.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Class Comparison









Class-level facets reveal differences: class 3A clusters above 70, while 3I shows a wider spread, hinting at varying teaching quality or peer effects.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Density Plot Analysis









The density curves highlight subtle gender differences in math performance, with female students showing a more concentrated distribution compared to males who display greater variability, particularly in the middle score range.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Violin Plot Comparison









Violin plots effectively illustrate the probability density of scores across genders, showing that while medians are similar, male students exhibit greater variance and a slight bimodal tendency in math performance.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Subject Relationship


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'









The scatter plot reveals a moderate positive correlation between Math and English scores, suggesting that students who excel in one subject tend to perform well in the other, though numerous outliers indicate exceptions to this pattern.

title: Hand-on Ex01
text:
Alternative Subject Comparison View









Flipping axes improves readability and makes overlap among subjects obvious; English remains top, Science lags with more low outliers. This orientation better highlights score ranges and median differences between subjects, enhancing comparative analysis.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Warning: ggrepel: 287 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider
increasing max.overlaps









The comparison demonstrates how ggrepel’s text placement algorithm prevents overlapping labels, significantly improving readability compared to standard text annotations where labels obscure data points and each other.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Warning: ggrepel: 287 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider
increasing max.overlaps









The comparison demonstrates how ggrepel’s text placement algorithm prevents overlapping labels, significantly improving readability compared to standard text annotations where labels obscure data points and each other.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Professional Themes with ggthemes









Using The Economist theme transforms the histogram into publication-quality visualization with distinctive typography and color palette, demonstrating how themed approaches can lend credibility and professionalism to statistical graphics.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Typography-Focused Design









The enhanced typography is achieved using ggplot2’s native theming system with carefully adjusted text properties, creating a clean design with proper visual hierarchy and improved readability for reports and presentations.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Composite Figures with Patchwork









The side-by-side histograms created with patchwork enable efficient comparison of distributions between mathematics and English scores, revealing differences in central tendency and spread without requiring multiple separate figures.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Multi-Row Layout









This composite visualization integrates individual subject distributions with their correlation, creating a comprehensive analytical view that would otherwise require multiple separate charts, demonstrating patchwork’s ability to build complex multi-level layouts.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Auto-Tagged Composite Figure









Automatic tagging adds professional reference points to each panel, making the composite figure suitable for formal reports where specific panels need to be referenced in accompanying text.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Inset Chart









The inset technique efficiently uses space by embedding the English score distribution within the correlation plot, allowing readers to reference the relevant distribution without switching between figures.

title: Hand-on Ex02
text:
Themed Composite Figure









Combining patchwork with ggthemes creates professionally styled composite figures with consistent design elements across all panels, demonstrating how multiple extension packages can work together to produce polished statistical graphics.
